definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: As early as in the spring and Autumn period, the island of Zhifu is a famous place.
sentences.chinese: 早在春秋时代，芝罘岛就是个有名的地方。

sentences.english: In the Spring and Autumn Period, in the State of Qi there was a man who always let his imagination run away with him.
sentences.chinese: 春秋时代，杞国有一个喜欢胡思乱想的人。

sentences.english: Writing poems was a ritual to express individual's political ideal and ambition in the Spring-and-Autumn Period.
sentences.chinese: 春秋时代，赋诗是政治理想与个人志向的表达方式。

sentences.english: In the Spring and Autumn period, copper and iron chopsticks came into being.
sentences.chinese: 在春秋时代又出现了铜制和铁制的筷子。

sentences.english: Its origin dates back to the Spring and Autumn Period.
sentences.chinese: 清明节可以追溯到春秋时代。

sentences.english: During Spring&Autumn period, the language of Chu was quite different to the language used in Central plain.
sentences.chinese: 在春秋时代，楚语和中原语言之间有明显的区别。

sentences.english: In the ring and Autumn period, co er and iron cho ticks came into being.
sentences.chinese: 在春秋时代又出现了铜制和铁制的筷子。

sentences.english: In the Spring and Autumn Period, Duke Huan of Qi led an army to attack a small state in the north.
sentences.chinese: 春秋时代，齐桓公出征攻打北方一个小国。

sentences.english: In the Spring and Autumn Period, there was an expert archer.
sentences.chinese: 春秋时代有个人射箭的技术非常高超。

sentences.english: In the Spring and Autumn Period, a man in the State of Song raised monkeys.
sentences.chinese: 春秋时代，宋国有一个人，养了一大群猴子。

sentences.english: Having seen the crisis appearance of existence on the Spring and Autumn Period, Confucius set his mind on carrying forward Ren to benefit mankind.
sentences.chinese: 面对春秋时代的生存危机现象，孔子有志于弘道济世。

sentences.english: Spring and Autumn Period in Chinese history is an important period of social transformation.
sentences.chinese: 春秋时代是中国历史上社会转型的重要时期。

sentences.english: Bole whose real name is Yang Sun, he is the person Spring and Autumn Period.
sentences.chinese: 第一个被称作伯乐的人本名孙阳，他是春秋时代的人。

definition: the Spring and Autumn (770-476 BC) and Warring States (475-221 BC) periods/Eastern Zhou (770-221 BC)
pinyin: Chun1 qiu1 Zhan4 guo2 Shi2 dai4

definition: the Spring and Autumn (770-476 BC) and Warring States (475-221 BC) periods
the Warring States period (475-221 BC)/Japanese Warring States period (15th-17th century)

the Five Hegemons of the Spring and Autumn period (770-476 BC), namely: Duke Huan of Qi 齊桓公|齐桓公[Qi2 Huan2 gong1], Duke Wen of Jin 晉文公|晋文公[Jin4 Wen2 gong1], King Zhuang of Chu 楚莊王|楚庄王[Chu3 Zhuang1 wang2], and alternatively Duke Xiang of Song 宋襄公[Song4 Xiang1 gong1] and Duke Mu of Qin 秦穆公[Qin2 Mu4 gong1] or King Helu of Wu 吳王闔閭|吴王阖闾[Wu2 wang2 He2 Lu:2] and King Gou Jian of Yue 越王勾踐|越王勾践[Yue4 wang2 Gou1 Jian4]
pre-Qin, Chinese history up to the foundation of the Qin imperial dynasty in 221 BC
Zhou Dynasty/Western Zhou 西周 (1046-771 BC) and Eastern Zhou 東周|东周 (770-221 BC)
Lu, vassal state at the time of the Zhou Dynasty 周朝|周朝[Zhou1 chao2], located in the southwest of present-day Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1], birthplace of Confucius
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
History of the Southern States Wu and Yue (traditional rivals), compiled by Han historian Zhao Ye 趙曄|赵晔[Zhao4 Ye4], 10 extant scrolls
